intro: Erigeron subglaber, commonly known as the slender fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and prairies, and it thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered with fine hairs, while the flowers are small and white to pale blue. It plays a role in supporting pollinators like bees and butterflies.
